alert.note: Alert for Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 18 at 8:33PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...For the Yukon River, from the mouth of the Nowitna River to Koyukuk, including Galena * WHEN...Through Noon Saturday * IMPACTS...Flooding of low lying areas along the Yukon River is now occurring near the Nowitna River area. Flooding of low lying areas is expected to move downstream Friday through Saturday. Flooding is possible at Galena and Koyukuk. Water could rise rapidly and fish camps and cabins along the Yukon River from the mouth of the Nowitna River to the Koyukuk could become flooded. Ruby is not expected to flood due to its elevation above the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - On Thursday afternoon, an ice jam remains in place on the Yukon River 20 miles upstream of Ruby. Ice has stopped moving from 50 miles upriver of the jam. Extensive overbank flooding is occuring near the ice jam. At Galena, water is falling, indicating the ice jam is holding water upstream. When the jam releases, a surge of high water and ice will move rapidly downriver that could flood Galena and Koyukuk and low areas Friday through Saturday. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Yukon River between the Nowitna and Koyukuk Rivers stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys
